fields.description:
This text appears randomly when you go to delete a component that is in use:

getText('admin.delete.component.issues.in.comp')

Screenshot attached.

B
fields.summary: Delete component displays erratic message

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA, if an issue has one or more subtasks, they are displayed in a table in the parent issue, and a form appears below them where new subtasks can be quickly created.  Sometimes it would be useful for this quick subtask creation form to *always* be shown:

!subtask-quickform.png!

This should be optional, since in some circumstances subtasks are unusual (and a form would be distracting), and in some they are common.
fields.summary: Optionally show quick subtask create form even when there are no subtasks

fields.description:
Hi, 

After some deletes or modifications, I encountered some service crushes. Also, sometimes, I'm able to create tasks but can't see them. I don't have any message. 
After a lot of investiguation, I discovered that it was a problem of Indexes. 
Is this problem present only in Standalone Demo versions ?

Thanks, 
Slim.
fields.summary: Index problems with Standalone Jira Demo Version

fields.description: Whenever anyone with an email signature with a graphic image sends and email directly into our Jira system, the issue is created, but the text / description of the issue is blank and the image is an attachment.  All other text within the body of the email which should be the issue description is lost.
fields.summary: Lose text of email sent into Jira if email has embedded graphic image with body of text

fields.description:
The system "Assigned to Me" filter is a continuing source of grief for us because it includes, as part of its query terms, a stipulation that the resolution be "unresolved".   As folks innocently customize their dashboards or use the default dashboard, they see that filter and use it thinking it will work as the name literally implies.  There then follows a period of unpleasantness when issues that are assigned to them with resolutions set to other than "Unresolved" are not seen.   Angry words are exchanged.  Innocent bystanders are slaughtered.  Jira admins are lynched ;)

In our workflow (and I would assume many other workflows), issue resolution is set by the development team before an issue is handed of to either the build guy for inclusion in a build or the QA team for validation so this filter, as shipped, isn't particularly helpful.

Please make one of the three following changes (in decreasing order of preference):

1.  Modify the filter criteria to reflect the name - remove the stipulation about resolution
2.  Modify the filter name to reflect the criteria - "Unresolved Issues Assigned to Me"
3.  Remove the filter completely - It's dangerous (in my mind anyway)
fields.summary: System default "Assigned to Me" filter is misleading
Suppress notifications on issue updates

fields.description: When I chane CustomField combo on the AddNotifications screen, right radiobutton becomes selected to AllWatchers, not UserCustomFieldValue (which would be most logical).
fields.summary: AddNotifications: AllWatchers selected when changing CustomField combo

fields.description: When trying to view non-existing issue in existing project (e.g via Quick search), NullPointerException appears in log. Standard "ISSUE DOES NOT EXIST" screen appears on user interface, however three NPE exceptions in log don't look good. See attachment for log.
fields.summary: NPE in log when trying to view non-existing issue

fields.description: An example of how this could be used is whereby you want to send a manual reminder to all the watchers without necessarilly wanting to open & edit / change the JIRA item in order for the notification to be trigerred.
fields.summary: Under the section  "Operations"  add another user operation called  "Send Notification(s) Now".

fields.description: Please make the Time Sheet Summary portlet configurable, so that I can see for example "last seven days" instead of the current view "this week"
fields.summary: Time Sheet Summary should be configurable to a timeframe

fields.description:
Following translations confuses our JIRA-user:
When you 'create' an new item then you can select in the fields 'Komonente' (=Components), 'Betrifft Version(en)' (=affected Version(s)) and 'Umsetzung geplant in Version' the value 'unbekannt' (unknown). The user interprete this value as a 'real' value (that they really on't know the right value) and not as a kept free attribute! Other fields like custom fields displayes instead the option 'none' (unfortunately not yet translated in German!!) when they don't select any value for a field! What the confusion increase is that in the items detail view the value 'keine' (none) is displayed instead of 'unbekannt'.

May be this is not only a German translation problem! I guess this is a general issue in all languages (as well in English with 'none' and 'unknown').
fields.summary: Mixed up translation for the word 'unknown' in JIRA's fields components and both versions

fields.description: When once a custom field is associated with a default value you aren't able to deactivate this default value (there is no button or link to deactivate a default value). The only thing you can do is to switch to another option value but not to deactivate this feature. This is real bad because you can't delete the current selected default value if you won't switch to another default value!
fields.summary: Can't deactivate default value for costum fields
Add javadoc to SearchParameter classes.

fields.description:
When restoring a JIRA backup using the Jetty appserver, JIRA either freezes or throws an error.

Anton's comment:

bq. At the momnet importing the data from XML does not work with inline-jdbc. The reason is that to speed thinsg up the import code disables local transaction handling and assumes that all connections have setAutoCommit enabled. The problem is that inline-jdbc puts connections into transactional mode.
fields.summary: JIRA data restore on Jetty fails

fields.description:
When you click the "find issues" option while using https, you get an Security Information popup telling "This page contains both secure and nonsecure items. Do you want to display the nonsecure items?".
This popup shows in Internet Explorer (6 sp2) but doesn't show in firefox.

I have looked into this a bit and there does not seem to be an obvious cuprit, no images or css links using http.
fields.summary: Security Information popup when you use https in find issues

Add another user option under  "Operations"  called   "Make item a sub-task".   This option will then take the current JIRA item and allow the user to specify which JIRA item will become its new  "parent".
Would be very beneficial if the PDF documentation that is released has on the first page a very clear reference to teh version of JIRA that it applies to (eg version 3.5.1, etc, etc, etc)
Update documentation for entityengine.xml online

fields.description:
Certain methods dosn't seem to work with Python. Users have reported errors when running:

# addPermissionTo
# createProject
# deletePermissionFrom
# updateProject

You get errors like 

{code}
SOAPpy.Types.faultType: <Fault soapenv:Server.userException: org.xml.sax.SAXException: Invalid eleme
nt in com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteEntity - name: <SOAPpy.Types.structType detail at 2208
2304>: {'hostname': 'JIRASERVERONE', 'faultData': <SOAPpy.Types.structType faultData at 22082504>: {
'exception': None, 'message': 'Invalid element in com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteEntity - n
ame'}}>
{code}

and 

{code}
org.xml.sax.SAXException: Invalid element in com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteEntity - users
{code}

We'll need to setup a Python Environment and see if we can figure something out.
fields.summary: Certain SOAP methods dosn't seem to work with Python

fields.description: We have a doc about the stop words here, http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Words+ignored+when+searching. Perhaps we can clean this up and add a bit about how the stemmer may make things "less than intuitive".
fields.summary: Add to the searching docs sections of stop words and about how the lucene stemmer works

fields.description: The outward description example text is the same as the inward description example text (e.g. "is duplicated by"). The text should be: e.g. "duplicates".
fields.summary: Minor typo in Edit Link Type outward description example text

fields.description: I am using the date format 'yyyy-MM-dd' and this works for the most part.  However, I entered the date '2006-02-278' (hit the 7 and 8 at the same time in error) and JIRA accepted it and put '2006-11-05'.  It should reject this invalid date.
fields.summary: Strange date with 'yyyy-MM-dd' format

Hi,
I'd like to choose the internationalisation user parameter when I create a user.
In fact, we have many users from others countries and they don't want to see their first connection in our defaut language and they don't want to have to change their preferences.
Thanks

User creation : Generate Password automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9478].
  {panel}

At the moment the JIRA-API does not allow to create new security levels or add an existing user group to a security level. In class com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueLevelSecurities you can delete levels and clear user level.  Currently there is only the way through com.atlassian.jira.jelly.tag.admin.enterprise.AddIssueSecurityLevel by using the jelly class what is quite cumbersome and I think using this class is not the generic way to create new security levels .
Perhaps this functionality could be added in one of the upcoming releases ?
Best
Franz
fields.summary: Enlarge API for IssueSecurityLevels to be able to create a new security level and add a user group to a security level.

fields.description: Currently, the custom field context and the hide/show feature of field configs are almost exactly the same. This can be very confusing.
fields.summary: Custom Field contexts and Field Configurations are the same

fields.description:
The workflow cache is not updated on project creation.

To reproduce:

1. Setup clean JIRA.
2. View workflows (system *jira* workflow is inactive).
3.  Create a project.
4. Refresh workflows screen - *jira* workflow is still inactive even though it is associated with the new project.

Need to refresh the active workflow cache on project creation.
fields.summary: Workflow cache not updated on project creation.

fields.description: If you to view the Time Tracking report from outside of Jira (through a url), an error *"There is no project selected."* is thrown. This is because the time tracking report obtains the project information from the session, not the url.
fields.summary: Cannot view Time Tracking Report remotely

fields.description: Need to ensure taht all the available RPC methods are clearly described. Would be great if we come up with an automated way to generate docs from source. Something like javadoc.
fields.summary: Document all of the SOAP and XML-RPC interfaces

fields.description:
Can Jira be setup to automatically backup Jira contents similiar to the functionality provided in Confluence. Confluence and perform automatic daily backups.

We are running Jira using an external Oracle database. We performed daily backups of the Jira database, but did not backup Jira contents using the XML backup facility. 

This week we lost the Oracle database which contained the Jira schema.  After re-installing Oracle, we restored the Jira schema from the previous day. All of the projects where there but could not find any of the Jira issues. We had to restore from an XML backup created back in Janauary 2006 which overwrote the Jira database. We now have all of our Jira projects and issues from January, but lost all other data to the present.

What we are looking for, is an automated process to backup Jira and a process to recover in case of failure.

Also, are there any documented procedures for the proper way to backup Jira and restore in case of a failure.

Thanks,
Dan Riesland
Verisae Inc.
fields.summary: Provide capability to automatically backup Jira contents.

fields.description:
When beginning a bulk issue change, I'm usually looking at the result of a filter, or search, then click on Bulk Change.  When the Bulk Change is complete, JIRA takes me back to the results of the filter or search I was just looking at, and it usually ends up showing no issues..  So I see a message of "No matching issues found".

This is misleading, and made me think that several of my bulk changes failed.  You should either show me a confirmation  message that my issues were successfully changed/moved, or take me to a different page that doesn't show messages such as this, such as the browse project page.
fields.summary: After Completing Bulk Issue Change, Show a Confirmation Msg

fields.description: When on Step 3 of a bulk issue change, it would be nice if the check box is automatically selected when I start choosing values in list boxes, or typing text in a text field.  I find that after typing and selecting, then proceeding to the next step, I get an error that I haven't selected any fields to change.  But I did type text and make selections in list boxes.
fields.summary: Auto-select checkboxes on Step 3 bulk issue changes
Components should have a URL just like the project
CustomField Storage when created by Workflow Post Function at initial Workflow Transition

fields.description: The JIRA install is in French. I'm trying to change my language by changing my profile and setting it to English (UK). It works fine but when I go to the home page or when I log again the lanugage is again sert to French even though my profile setting still say English (UK).
fields.summary: Profile language setting is being reset
Add ability to create sub tasks via SOAP and XML-RPC
Update global permissions of the documentation to include teh Bulk Change permission

fields.description:
Related to my JSP-4241 issue where I found Apache's mod_deflate to be a little flaky, I tried a different route and added this to JIRA's web.xml:

    <filter-mapping>
        <filter-name>gzip</filter-name>
        <url-pattern>*.js</url-pattern>
    </filter-mapping>

And JIRA is now compressing all the JS files that it sends which offers quite a bandwidth savings for my remote users considering the dashboard has about 123kb of javascript files.

I tried adding *.css but it isn't compressing those.

Can we have the *.js compression configured by default (assuming it passes your QA) (when gzip compression is turned on) and can we have *.css supported by the Filter as well?
fields.summary: Increase the scope of the gzip compression to include JS and CSS files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9460].
  {panel}

This is from a user:
Recently I remarked that it would be nice if Jira standalone setup  could just import instead of requiring a setup first and then an import.
I don't know if this has been there for a long time (or always) but I  notice 3.5.1 has this - it's just not quite as obvious as it could be.
Score 1 Atlassian!
I would however add a new initial screen - with two clear choices  "Setup a new Jira installation" and "Import existing Jira data"
Make it really obvious for us people who are in too much of a hurry  to read the fine print properly
fields.summary: It would be nice if JIRA started with two clear choices  "Setup a new Jira installation" and "Import existing Jira data"

fields.description: It seems the the webwork url tag uses the system encoding when url encoding its parameters instead of the JIRA_WEBWORK_ENCODING as it should.  We will most likely need to redefine this tag in JIRA, using the correct encoding. Make sure you do not use the standard URLEncode method because of jdk 1.3, instead use URLCodec.
fields.summary: It seems the the webwork url tag uses the system encoding when url encoding its parameters instead of the JIRA_WEBWORK_ENCODING as it should

fields.description: We need to update the german and swiss language packs. Thanks to Arne.
fields.summary: Update language pack for german and swiss

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9457].
  {panel}

This new feature request is about a more effective interface to let you perform bulk operations on bugs, with more resolution than changing the same field(s) on every bug to the same thing. Let's call it a "mass" operation instead of "bulk".

Consider this scenario: you are doing triage on a set of open bugs - reprioritizing, potentially reassigning, setting due dates and versions, perhaps resolving as "postponed". This triage could be daily, or it could be the result of a change in schedule or feature set that makes you need to revisit a bunch of them. Now, as a producer or dev lead or whatever, you're very familiar with most of these bugs, so a glance at the Summary field in the Issue Navigator is usually enough to let you know what's going on.

I don't know about everyone else who uses Jira, but for my team this is a really common scenario. Anyway, right now you have two options to do your mass update:

  1. Go through every bug one at a time and do the combination of edits, and workflow transitions required.
  2. Subdivide bulk edits based on type - so do all setting-to-pri-1 in one pass, setting-to-pri-2 in another pass, reassigning-to-Bob in another pass...

Both of these are really tedious and it makes it really hard to go through a lot of bugs and update them very quickly, to the point that we don't do it nearly as often as we should. I've got a proposal for this.

-----

Proposal:

Have a new "mass edit" feature that is similar to Step 1 of Bulk Operation: an Issue Navigator style grid, except instead of each field being static, have it be editable. If it's a priority field, say, it would become a drop-down of all priorities, with the current priority for that bug selected, rather than static text. If it's the Assignee field, it would become a drop-down of all available people to assign to (with the current assignee selected), and so on. There should also be a previous step to Mass Edit that lets you choose which fields appear in this grid, so what's visible is only what you want to change.

In addition, have a column at the end (enabled via that "previous step" I just mentioned) that lets you select possible workflow transitions, again via a drop-down (defaulting to "leave as-is") that shows all possible transitions for each bug - the same list as would appear in the "Operations" section on the left bar if you were to be viewing that individual bug.

The "next" step would confirm the changes that are proposed, and then a "next" after that to commit them. First it would do the edit updates, then it would do the workflow transitions. Perhaps it would give you a button to continue working with the bugs that had workflow transitions, in case you wanted to send them through further transitions (i.e. go back to step 1).

Maybe a better name for this feature would be Grid Mass Edit or something. Some other bugbases have this feature (such as Microsoft's RAID) and it's extremely useful for working quickly through a set of bugs.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit + per-bug edit ability

fields.description: When installing a new project tab plugin, the I18N label isn't found when on browse project screen EXCEPT when focused on the tab itself.
fields.summary: Project Tab I18N label being ignored

fields.description: I have a custom field setup as sub-component and logged issues where the field was populated ie 'Sub Component A'. We have gone through several releases and the name of 'sub component A' has changed. When I add a new option in my custom field and try to delete the old one, it says the following JIRAs will be affected. It doesn't allow be to migrate those JIRAs using the new one I just created. On the same note, when I do a search for those same JIRAs to manually do a bulk change from old custom field option to new custom field option, it won't allow me. Is there a solution for this?
fields.summary: Unable to bulk modifying custom fields

fields.description: When making a bulk change, I am  unable to add a comment with the change. This would be a very useful feature.
fields.summary: When making a bulk change, there is no place to add a comment

fields.description:
We've noticed that in JIRA 3.4.3 the send email functionality does not work.  The send Test email works, and the notification emails send fine, but using the send email option in the administration panels does not.    I have attached a video screenshot (AVI) compressed to zip format.  

Thanks.
fields.summary: Send email not functioning

fields.description: I've noticed during the last few builds that when I've been updating a workflow,  I can not add post functions that unassign an issue.  Existing post functions still work.  The work around I've been using is to edit the xml and re-import the workflow.  This is time consuming.
fields.summary: Last two builds JIRA won't allow setting an issue to unassigned as a Post function in workflow transitions

fields.description:
If you put an @ sign into the summary, say "Tell marc@anyware he has found a bug", when this issue is shown in the roadmap, the link for the issue summary is broken/bad and includes a mailto: link to "marc@anyware" because some renderer is causing nested <a> tags in the output html. 

This does not happen in other views such as issue navigator or "assigned to me" portlet.
fields.summary: Including AT (@) sign in issue summary creates bad links in Roadmap

fields.description:
When downloading a navigator issue list as html or a word listing, the URL contains the parameter „view=full" but only 20 issues (or whatever is set in the user's preferences) are downloaded. 

This is impractical. There should be a way to request all items without forcing the user to go back to his preferences, changing the setting to some very large number, downloading the list as html or word listing and then changing the setting back.
fields.summary: view=full does not show all issue

fields.description:
for me, even a simple refresh of a task that I am viewing and have not changed takes several seconds

There needs to be some configuration or filter written that can tune the cache settings for the transfers so that the client can cache some of the data on the clinet for a small period of time, and use the if-updated-since headers for the transfers that are not cacheable

Attached is a summary, and timings required to perform a refresh

summary is produced with IEInspector http://www.ieinspector.com/
fields.summary: JIRA HTTP transfers in not efficient - need to allow browsers to cache images, javascript and css files

fields.description: sometime it is usful to workflow a number of faults at the same time. The current interface is not supportive of this
fields.summary: Bulk operations should allow for state change

fields.description:
This is what I have noticed:

ver 3.5.1:
1. Notifications associated with "Issue Commented"   ***DOES***   work (ie notifications are sent out correctly) only if comments are applied to a JIRA item that has not yet been Resolved.
2. Notifications associated with "Issue Commented"   ***DOES NOT***   work (ie notifications are NOT sent out at all) if comments are applied AFTER the JIRA item has been Resolved.
fields.summary: Notifications associated with "Issue Commented" (under "Edit Notifications") does not work if the item has been Resolved.  (see Detailed Description below)

fields.description:
This is what I have noticed:

ver 3.5.1:
1. Notfications associated with "Issue Updated"   ***DOES***   work (ie notifications are sent out correctly) only if notifications associated with "Issue Created" is enabled.
2. Notfications associated with "Issue Updated"   ***DOES NOT***   work (ie notifications are NOT sent out at all) if notifications associated with "Issue Created" is disabled.
fields.summary: Notifications associated with "Issue Updated" (under "Edit Notifications") does not work all the time. (see Detailed Description below)
Notifications associated with "Issue Resolved" (under "Edit Notifications") does not work all the time. Notifications under this trigger only works sometimes, but mostly not at all.

fields.description:
Would it be possible to change or to ad the transition view for initial step?
I think this would be usefull so you can create initial view (screen) where you can create only filed that is needed for reporters.
fields.summary: Change transition view for initial step of workflow

Ability to select any  "sub-task item"  in JIRA and have the ability to  "promote"   it so it is no longer a sub-task item.  Having a "promote" button on the far left similar to "Clone" etc would be nice.

Ability to select any item in JIRA (irrespective of whether it is a  "parent item"  or a  "sub-task item") and move it under a different  "parent item"  so it can become a sub-task item under this new  "parent item".

fields.description:
When creating a sub-task, would be very useful if the user was prompted as to whether or not the user wants the new sub-task to inherit the properties of the parent item (eg all components to be inherited, etc, etc).

Would also be very nice if the user could select which fields from the parent item should be inherited down to the new sub-task being created.
fields.summary: Ability for sub-task items to inherit properties of its parent item

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9439].
  {panel}

Dear I think there is missing some function that will help to customize workflow and I think this will resolve also a lot of queries from users like this JRA-4812.
Please could it be possible to add the INITIALIZATION part between the CONDITIONS and VALIDATORS parts?
This is on the View Workflow Transition page, where you can add some conditions, validators and post functions.
This is the same way but there will be possible to add some plugins to initialize the issue when the transition is started.
This will be very usefull for default values of any filed on the screen that is associated with transition.
Also this can be usefull for create (initial) transition where then will be possible to initialize any filed before the form is populated to the user.
Also there will be possible to change requireness of any filed for the current transition.
And lastly there will be possible to run any plugin that will be created before the transition is started.

This actions is not possible to do by Conditions or by Validators because this is exatly between it.
Thank you for answer.
Best Regards
fields.summary: Add Initialization to the transitions of workflow
"Change Assign To" sounds weird

fields.description:
Links are lost after a subtask is moved.

I have subtask A that is linked to task B. If I moved the subtask A to task C, the link between A and B is lost.
fields.summary: Issue Links are lost after a subtask is moved to a new parent

fields.description:
in fixing JRA-9415, IssueEvents (of type IssueUpdate) will be fired with a null changelog if there is an edit to an issue that has no other change than a comment.

The upgrade guide needs to warn developers of custom listeners not to assume this property will never be null.
fields.summary: Add to Upgrade Guide advice that IssueEvent changelog can now be null
Custom field to allow searching on all updated dates

fields.description:
Clarified "Updated" date searches as "Last Updated" searches. This can be confusing for some people.

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=10091

We _could_ change the "Updated" to "Last Updated" but that may make the GUI a more clunky. If that looks bad, then it might be best to just update the tooltip.
fields.summary: Clarify "Updated" date searches as "Last Updated" searches

fields.description:
We need to allow portlets and reports to provide their own WebWork actions for configuration. These would be optional, and if provided would replace the existing object configuration fields screen. The existing screen is nice (v. simple!) but doesn't have the power if you want to do complex configuration (ie field A or B, or preselect a value in field B based on something else in the URL). 

This is a big impediment to plugin developers!
fields.summary: Allow portlets and reports to provide their own action for configuration

fields.description: See JRA-9396 for the full details.
fields.summary: Add documentation that specifys that text emails for subscriptions do not behave the same way as html emails

fields.description:
When i minimise some of the admin menu sections and browse through other menu items, sometimes on certain menus the minimised menus expand back

Steps to reproduce:
# Goto Admin
# Minimise the {{Projects}} and {{Users and Groups}} admin menu section
# Click on {{Sub-Tasks}} or {{Workflows}} (there may be other menus which also forgets the minimised menus)
fields.summary: Admin menu does not remember minimised menus on some menu items

fields.description:
Team: 

When creating a customized filter, we have the ability to multi-select "Priority", which is a sytem defined select list. 

We would like that same functionality on a project level "select list" custom field. Currently, when creating a filter, we can only choose one option, instead of multiple.

Is their a way around implementing this?

Regards,
Amrita
fields.summary: Abiltiy to multi select values when creating a filter against a select list custom field...

fields.description: It would be very helpful to be able to filter by Project Category from the Filter criteria - currently can't do this.
fields.summary: Add "Category" to Filter selection criteria.

fields.description:
Often I attach PNGs to issues. Jira displays JPEG thumbnails of those attached PNGs.

Those JPEGs are the same dimensions as the PNGs, yet the JPEGs are 6x the file size of the pngs and are much blurrier.

When a PNG does not need to be resized and has a smaller file size than the JPEG equivalent, Jira should use the PNG itself for a thumbnail instead of a JPEG.
fields.summary: Don't create a thumbnail when the actual image would work better.
Allow configuring colour of company banner in Look and Feel section
Active directory login problem

fields.description:
When creating a user called "michaël", the user is succesfully created, however it is not possible to assign the user to groups (user not found) or to edit it (Oops - an error has occurred). It's also not possible to delete the user.

The Tomcat connector has {{useBodyEncodingForURI="true"}} in the server.xml.

The error shown when trying to edit the user:
{code}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.user.GenericEditProfile.doDefault(GenericEditProfile.java:21)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

fields.summary: Problems with username containing "ë".

fields.description:
We have only few projects that use time tracking feature; for others it's extra info they don't need to deal with -- neither in viewing issue, search criterias, available actions on left-side action bar or even available reports.

We'd be happy to be able to turn off Time Tracking for most projects, leaving it available only when a team needs it.

Looks like the feature makes sense for a large organization where different teams have different usage disciplines on bugtracking.
fields.summary: turn time tracking on/off on per-project basis

fields.description:
On projects where no components are set, it would be great to hide component information in:
- find issues screen
- view issue screen
- create issue screens (even if Component field is included in specific screen scheme)

Same rule would make sense for Versions.
fields.summary: hide Versions and/or Components on projects without any

fields.description:
setArchived and setReleased in RemoteVersion does nothing in SOAP RPC.

It should release or archive a version if this is set
fields.summary: setArchived and setReleased in RemoteVersion does nothing

fields.description:
As many portel products use the JSR-168 standard for portlets, it would be very beneficial (from an interopability point of view) to ensure that all JIRA porlets were JSR-168 compliant. Customers could then easily add JIRA portlets to their portals.

http://developers.sun.com/prodtech/portalserver/reference/techart/jsr168/
fields.summary: JIRA portlets should be JSR-168 compliant
Create a workflow post-function to allow dynamic time tracking

fields.description: When doing an edit issue or a bulk edit and only adding a comment an IssueUpdated event is not thrown. We need to be throwing an issueUpdated event in this case. Be careful, because when just adding a comment (via add comment), we want the issueCommented event to be thrown.
fields.summary: When doing an edit issue or a bulk edit and only adding a comment an IssueUpdated event is not thrown

fields.description:
Hi,

When modifying the Issue Navigator columns, it would be useful to be able to specify a default sort order, just as you would when creating and saving a filter.  At the moment, only column type and position can be changed.

Thanks,

Rowan.
fields.summary: Allow default sort order in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
When different users use different locale, you as a watcher receive notifications in different locale, depending on what locale is set by bug Reporter (or initiator of event?)

It would be more logical to receive notifications in recipient's locale.
fields.summary: email notifications sent in Reporter's locale, not in recipient's
Need to document Java security policy settings

fields.summary: Not able to startup JIRA

fields.description:
I have an issue security scheme for "Reporter and Assignee Only".

Where this breaks down, is when a manager assigns a private issue to someone. That person then updates information, but wants to assign it back to their manager to force their manager to respond to their comment, the person can no longer see the issue.

Also, sometimes the issue is private, but you want to dynamically bring a random person into that issue.

What I really want is, "let anyone who has been assigned the issue at some point be alloweded to see that issue". Which could work off of the "Participants" field that is in the toolkit.

Or, "Let anyone that has been added as a Watcher be able to view this issue"
fields.summary: Allow issue security based on "Participants" or "Watchers"
Possibility to show Due Dates of linked Issues

fields.description: It would be nice if one can configure the Issue Navigator to show the due dates of  subtasks when showing the parent issue.
fields.summary: Possibility to show Due Dates of Subtasks on Parent-Task

fields.description: The deleteComment action uses the CommentSystemField in such a way that it passes the wrong type of param to the getViewHtml method and generates a ClassCastException. The CommentSystemField changed to use velocity templates for its display, this needs to respect the params the field now accepts.
fields.summary: Delete comment does not display the comment as it should, it generates a classCastException

fields.description:
I don't know whether I should report this in JIRA or Confluence because it affects both. If I open JIRA and Confluence as tabs within the same Firefox window, clicking any link (or even refreshing) either application causes the other to logout. 

To reproduce: Open both apps as tabs. Log in to both apps. Now go back to whichever app you logged into FIRST and click a link. When the page redisplays, you'll find that you're not logged in anymore. If you login again, you'll kick yourself out of the other app.
fields.summary: Logging into JIRA logs you out of Confluence (and vice-versa)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9401].
  {panel}

We need to subscribe specific users to all/selected notifications on specific notifications. In our organization, we have ~20 teams which is why we need that different users subscribe for different projects, while notification scheme need to be the same (as it's unreal to manage 20 schemes which differ only in single specific user on some event types.

Both user-initiated and adminstrator-set subcription would suffice.

Examples of subscriptions we have are:
- project manager AND lead developer, on their project (PM <> lead dev are different people, and frequenly they both need to stay tuned)
- senior project manager, on projects of his category (each senior mentors his own category)
- head of development, on selected projects he mentors
- mailing list of specific project

Ability to select notification types would be nice to have, but it's ok to start with "all or nothing" option in our case.
fields.summary: project-level subscribe specific user within single notification scheme

fields.description:
When I create a user, from the administration -> user browser section, the user created event is not fired if I deselect the 'Send Password Email' option.

When I select the 'Send Password Email'  option, the event is fired, and my custom listener code is executed which is the expected behaviour.
fields.summary: User created event should be fired when password email is not sent

fields.description:
When moving issues from a project to other, the Update Fields view that allows setting values for issues uses the values from the originating project in the Security Level field. AFAIK the field should show values in the target project.

To reproduce:

# Create projects SOURCE and TARGET
# Create an Issue Security Scheme with at least one level
# Associate the scheme with TARGET
# Create issue in SOURCE
# Bulk Move the issue to TARGET
# In the Update Fields view, notice the pulldown selection for the Security Level only lists "None" even though TARGET has other valid field values

Workaround:

Before moving the issues, associate the security level scheme with the SOURCE project.

Possible fix would be that in the first screen for bulk moving issues, if the TARGET and SOURCE projects do not have same Issue Level Security scheme associated, warn users that they should first associate the same scheme to the projects or they will lose the field settings. Ideally of course the field should allow selecting the Security Level without this additional step.
fields.summary: Bulk Move - New security level field values are shown from originating project, not the target project

fields.description: We need to easily attach a screenshot when creating an issue. Not from a file, but from a clipboard.
fields.summary: ability to attach a screenshot when creating an issue

fields.description:
The Notification scheme has the entries 

|Issue Updated| |
|Issue Assigned |Current Assignee, Reporter|

If User 1 assigns a single issue to User 2, User 2 gets a notification email.

But if User 1 uses the bulk edit feature from the navigator to assign several issues to User 2, he does not get a notification email.

It seems that the bulk change is considered only an issue update, not a change assignee. 

I think this is a bug ar at least a problematic inconsistency. The assignee should get an email regardless of whether it has been triggered by a single action or by a bulk change. My customer relies on the emails being sent to the respective developers. If emails do not arrive, or if the send email notification feature is unreliable, it looks as if the developers are lazy and this is a severe problem.

This issue affects probably also earlier releases than 3.5, but I don't have test environments available right now.
fields.summary: Bulk change assignee doesn't send emails to Issue Assigned events
Show configured navigator columns in text email subscriptions

fields.description:
We use the jira-developers group in order to make internal comments. These comments contain sensitive information that should under no circumstances be viewable to the clients who use the jira-users group.

When you delete a comment that is visible to jira-developers, it becomes visible to the customer! They need to click on "Change History" or "All" to view the deleted comment.

Unfortunately, we had a situation the other day because a client saw a comment that was not meant for the client to see which has left us in a sticky situation.

As far as we are concerned, the "All" and "Change History" buttons should only show events that were carried out by users in your group. That is, jira-developers should see all the changes in the change history and jira-users should only see events caused by other jira-users. jira-users should also be able to see when a jira-developer has assigned an issue to a jira-user as that involves the jira-user group.

Please let us know when this will be resolved as we cannot have this situation continue as it is.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Security Bug: Deletion of a comment made to jira-developers is visible to all jira-users when viewing change history

fields.description:
The "Leave" function does not work with groups containing underscores in the group-name (e.g. EOP_standard). If you select users from this group and click on 'leave' you got the error message "Selected group 'EOP' does not exist'.
 
The "join" function makes no troubles!
fields.summary: Bulk Edit Group Members doesn't work with groupnames containing '_' (underscore) in group-names

fields.description:
Is there a way to have descriptions on each transition screen?
When you hover your mouse over an "Available Workflow Actions" 
it displays the short description you typed in when creating that 
transition screen.  However, when the transition screen pops up 
that description is absent.

I know you can display descriptions under each custom field.  
However, I would like the screen description within the screen itself 
(maybe next to the screen's title or right under it) 
because it would provide the user a brief overview of what is expected 
of him/her when transitioning the issue from step-to-step.

How can I do this within JIRA interface? or Where can I hard code it?
fields.summary: Description on Transition Screens

fields.description:
In my issue navigator, everything on the right-side of the <Links> columns appears shifted by one column for issue   PRX-860 and PRX-862  (look at the screenshot)

When we export to Excel, the same behaviour happens !!

I would strongly suggest, if you think it can help, to send you a backup of the database.

All the initial data of the <project> was initally import from csv and since then, it's seems like there is corruption on the data and really, really strange behaviour occurs like this one time to time !!!!

Cna you help us please !!
fields.summary: Bug in issue navigator with the Link column
